courses: Ethical, Legal, and Professional Impacts of the Digital Age
CSC 136: Comp Sci II OR CSC 220: OO Multimedia Prog OR CSC 223: Advanced Scientific Prog

Elective Courses.description: 18 credits of additional 200 level CSC courses, not previously used for above requirements, excluding CSC 280 and CSC 380

First Year Seminar.description: A course numbered FYS 100. Transfer students transferring 30 credits or more may select any approved general education course to meet their FYS requirement.

A. Communicating with and About the Worl.description: Must include  CMP 100 level course, a CMP 200 level course, an A2 speaking course, and an A2 or A3 course. Courses that share the student's major prefix may not be used.

B. Understanding Self and Others.description: Three category B courses. Courses that share the student's major prefix may not be used.

C. Understanding Science and Technology.description: A Scientific Inquiry course, a Quantitative Reasoning course, and a course approved for C1 or C2. Courses that share the student's major prefix may not be used.

D. Understanding and Creating Ideas.description: Three category D courses. Courses that share the student's major prefix may not be used.

Directed General Education.description: The following courses are required to fulfill the computer science requirements and are suggested to satisfy general education.
